page.title: 17THE SUB-POST OFFICE,HIGH HAM
page.content: High Ham is the only village in the block to have a post office.The Sub-Post Office is open on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, from 9.00am to 1.00pm and from 2.00pm to 3.00pm. About 30 pensioners collect their pensions and 20 mothers their family allowance from this Sub-Post Office. There had always been a Post Office in the village until 7 years ago when it closed. After a lapse of 3 years it re-opened in people's homes.Taunton Post Office is the head office. The Sub-Post Office in High Ham can issue pensions and family allowance, sell stamps and television licences,but it cannot take in savings, offer car tax or sell premium bonds. It also sells cards, wrapping-paper and stationery. The postman collects twice daily at 10am and 4pm, and delivers post to the houses in the area once a day.
